documentation.text:
Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address
 If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`,
 which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value
 `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`;
 otherwise, the transfer is reverted.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Cannot transfer to the same address."

arguments.value: Cannot transfer to the same address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Cannot transfer to the same address."

documentation.text:
Private function to clear current approval of a given token ID
 Reverts if the given address is not indeed the owner of the token

Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address
 If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`,
 which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value
 `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`;
 otherwise, the transfer is reverted.

Internal function to invoke `onERC721Received` on a target address
 The call is not executed if the target address is not a contract

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}. Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted.

Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted.
